result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Damontra L Davis

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Damontra L Davis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in Court for Damontra L Davis.  Attorney William T. Berens on behalf of Attorney Daniel T Flaherty in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense requested additional time to review discovery and meet with Defendant. Court granted Defense request. Case adjourned for Status hearing, Branch 46. Status hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:30 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 18 pages) commencing 09-01-2022 by Kristin Menzia.

Defendant Damontra L Davis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland appeared by video for Damontra L Davis.  Attorney Daniel T Flaherty appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.** 
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received discovery material and an offer from the State. Defense requested an adjournment to allow time to review Discovery. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 10:45 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Hanrahan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Feiss, Br. 46.

Defendant Damontra L Davis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland appeared by video for Damontra L Davis.  Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of case #18CF006 and case #18CF3111. Sworn for the State: MPD Detective J. Bohn. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Damontra L Davis not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminray hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests that this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with Angel M.R.; Tragelia Y.R.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Damontra L Davis in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Damontra L Davis in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Damontra L Davis appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04.  AS TO COUNT 1:  Motion to dismiss by defense for lack of probable cause argued and DENIED by the Court.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
